page.title: 16Tockwith Children's Pets
page.content: Pet Survey. Out of 95 of us, 72 keep a pet at home. 32 of us keep more than 1 pet. In order of popularity our pets are; dogs, fish, cats, guinea pigs, rabbits, budgerigars, hamsters, tortoises, slow-worms and stick insects. Chris Hall's dog is a small Yorkshire terrier called Scamp. He has long furry hair. He eats Pedigree Chum and mixer. Scamp has a bath every 2 or 3 weeks. He lives all over the house, but sleeps on a thick blanket on the landing. Chris and his sister take him for walks. He gets lots of exercise. Penny Jaram's stick insect lives in a glass tank. During the day it sits on the lid. She often holds it. It is hermaphrodite, laying about 80 eggs a year. Every morning she removes the eggs. She gives it privet leaves to eat. It goes on holiday with her.
